title: Conqueror's Haki is Inherited Through the Will of D
summary: A theory that Conqueror's Haki is genetically passed down through lineages, particularly the Will of D, explaining why Luffy, Roger, Ace, and Garp all possess this rare ability.
fullText: The manifestation of Luffy's Conqueror's Haki at Marineford supports the theory that this rare power is inherited through bloodlines, especially those bearing the initial 'D'. Vice Admiral Doberman's comment that Luffy's possession of Conqueror's Haki makes sense because he is Dragon's son reinforces this connection. The fact that Garp, Dragon, and Luffy all have connections to this power, along with Roger and Ace, suggests a genetic component tied to the mysterious Will of D.
author: One Piece Community

title: Luffy's Unconscious Haki Parallels Roger's Power
summary: A theory suggesting that Luffy's unconscious display of Conqueror's Haki at Marineford mirrors Gol D. Roger's own power, indicating Luffy is Roger's spiritual successor.
fullText: When Luffy unconsciously used Conqueror's Haki to stop Ace's execution, it created parallels to Gol D. Roger's own mastery of this power. Some fans theorize that Shanks recognized this same power in young Luffy in Chapter 1, which is why he entrusted him with his straw hat - the same hat Roger once wore. The fact that Luffy manifested this power in a desperate moment to save his brother, just as Roger would have done for his crew, suggests Luffy carries Roger's will forward.
author: One Piece Theory Community

title: Garp Intentionally Allowed Himself to Be Defeated
summary: A theory that when Garp blocked Luffy's path in Episode 479, he was setting himself up to be defeated, as he couldn't bear to see either grandson die but was bound by his Marine duty.
fullText: Episode 479 ends with Garp blocking Luffy's path to Ace, declaring that Luffy must defeat him to pass. Fans theorize that Garp's conflicted emotions led him to take this position knowing that Luffy's determination would allow him to land a blow, giving Garp a 'legitimate' reason to step aside without betraying his Marine vows. His statement 'over my dead body' could be interpreted as Garp giving Luffy permission to do what's necessary. This theory is supported by Garp's earlier comment that he suspected Luffy was born with Conqueror's Haki, showing his awareness of Luffy's potential.
author: r/OnePiece Community

title: The Admirals Prioritized Luffy After Witnessing His Haki
summary: A theory that the Marine Admirals shifted their strategy to prioritize eliminating Luffy after witnessing his Conqueror's Haki, recognizing him as a future threat on par with Roger.
fullText: After Luffy exhibited Conqueror's Haki at Marineford, the Marine Admirals became wary enough of him that they prioritized his elimination. This suggests that the Marines recognized Luffy's potential to become as dangerous as Gol D. Roger, who also possessed Conqueror's Haki. The theory posits that the World Government saw Luffy's unconscious display as proof that he would eventually become a Revolutionary on the scale of his father Dragon or a Pirate King candidate like Roger, making him too dangerous to let escape Marineford alive.
